storyInfo: The reorganized Defense Forces set forth to maintain order in Londinium. Millscar is smuggling Sarkaz out of the city. Vina officiates a memorial service for the fallen innocent.

attributes.content: I-I just go over there like this?
attributes.name: Nervous Child

attributes.content: Yes. Just go over there and ask what the price is.
attributes.name: Ill-Intentioned Citizen

attributes.content: A-Alright.
attributes.name: Nervous Child

attributes.content: The child approaches the merchant's stall and timidly peruses the wares.
Fireworks, kid?
attributes.name: Amiable Merchant

attributes.content: Y-Yeah...
attributes.name: Nervous Child

attributes.content: A special occasion? A gift? This one's real popular for celebrations!
attributes.name: Amiable Merchant

attributes.content: B-But there's a lot of dust—
attributes.name: Nervous Child

attributes.content: That's normal; it's been lying in the warehouse for a while. How about this, you buy one, and I'll give you one free—
attributes.name: Amiable Merchant
Amiable Merchant
attributes.content: What's that smell—

attributes.name: Amiable Merchant
attributes.content: Fire! It's you, isn't it?!
Hah!
attributes.name: Ill-Intentioned Citizen

attributes.content: What are you standing there for? Run!
attributes.name: Ill-Intentioned Citizen

attributes.content: The merchant tries to put out the fire to no avail, and is soon surrounded by flames himself.
The exploding fireworks draws a gawking crowd.
The 'practical joker' has long fled the scene with the child.
'But... wasn't it supposed to be a joke...'
'Serves him right for marrying a devil woman, the bastard.'
The fire's getting bigger! I'll grab the man; you get the crowd out of here!
Yes, ma'am!
attributes.name: Defense Force Patrol

attributes.content: The piledriver spear rips the flames apart. The sounds of explosions and crackling fire sing joyfully in cacophony.
A Vouivre emerges from the flames, spear in one hand, the merchant in the other. She puts the merchant down in a safe place, then sits beside him, wiping the soot off her face.
Ach, sorry aboot yer stall, I think I might've...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: It's fine, fine, don't worry.
attributes.name: Amiable Merchant

attributes.content: Fine? This is... fine?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: She points towards the raging fire, with fireworks still leaping out from time to time.
The gawking crowd continues to grow. A drunkard, seemingly oblivious to what is going on, pulls over an unsuspecting passerby and starts dancing.
Under the setting sun is pandemonium, drunken singing mixed with angry yelling mixed with the cackle of fireworks.
This street has not been so lively since the Sarkaz took over.
It is the very picture of chaos, but the merchant, who has already calmed down, begins to laugh.
I haven't seen the folks so happy in a very long time. Brings back memories...
attributes.name: Amiable Merchant

attributes.content: But... it's your stall that's on fire.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You know what? I'm in a good mood today. Let's just call it a fireworks show for everyone!
attributes.name: Amiable Merchant

attributes.content: Between you and me, ma'am... my wife can finally leave the city, tonight.
attributes.name: Amiable Merchant

attributes.content: No injuries, ma'am. Should we go after the troublemaker?
attributes.name: Defense Force Patrol

attributes.content: Well, nobody got hurt—
attributes.name: Amiable Merchant

attributes.content: We've got a duty to handle anyone who commits an offense.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Well, thank you, in any case. Say, can you dance? Or play an instrument?
attributes.name: Amiable Merchant

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Can't let good fireworks go to waste, can I?
attributes.name: Amiable Merchant

attributes.content: Maybe my wife will hear the commotion. My way of saying goodbye.
attributes.name: Amiable Merchant

attributes.content: *sigh* I'm startin' to miss wartime. Even workin' on the farm. Anythin's easier than this 'keepin' the peace' business.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: But, hey, if everyone's happy, who'm I tae complain?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Once she is satisfied that there is no danger, she lies down on a crate by the roadside, stretches, and lets the beams of the setting sun fall upon her face.
Gimme a haystack over this any day.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Where are you, Chenchen...?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Wh-Why did you burn his stall? You said you were just going to snitch something!
attributes.name: Nervous Child

attributes.content: That shameless bastard's own fault for marrying a devil.
attributes.name: Ill-Intentioned Citizen
Ill-Intentioned Citizen
attributes.content: On the bright side, maybe somebody's already lynched his wife—

attributes.name: Ill-Intentioned Citizen
attributes.content: Whoa!
Who the feck are you?
attributes.name: Ill-Intentioned Citizen

attributes.content: Now's your chance to run, kid.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: O-Okay!
attributes.name: Nervous Child

attributes.content: Wh-What do you want?
attributes.name: Ill-Intentioned Citizen

attributes.content: Just doing a favor for a client. Maybe it'll bring in future business.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: What's the situation with this batch?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Coast is clear, and the head count checks out, no problem. But word on the streets is that Parliament is looking for you.
attributes.name: Tired Mercenary

attributes.content: Nothing they can actually do about it. Same as before, don't cause any trouble.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Speaking of trouble...
attributes.name: Tired Mercenary

attributes.content: There's a kid in this batch that's giving us a hard time.
attributes.name: Tired Mercenary

attributes.content: Why can't I see my dad one last time before we leave?
attributes.name: Indignant Child

attributes.content: This man says there's fireworks outside. It's dad's fireworks!
attributes.name: Indignant Child

attributes.content: Shh, quiet.
attributes.name: Nervous Woman

attributes.content: You don't want to leave either, do you, Mum—
attributes.name: Indignant Child

attributes.content: The Sarkaz covers the child's mouth and holds her tightly, gazing up nervously at the woman looking quietly down at her.
I'm sorry, she's just not used to this... her father never left her side, even during the war.
attributes.name: Nervous Woman

attributes.content: Our deal with your husband was to get you out of the city. The rest is not my business.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: If you want to stay, that's also your own decision.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Ma'am, they're just scared because they've never been through anything like this.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: None of us have... Don't worry, I'll take care of the girl. She won't cause you any trouble.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: But where are we going? What about Dad?
attributes.name: Indignant Child

attributes.content: He'll come find us once he's taken care of things at home.
attributes.name: Nervous Woman

attributes.content: *sigh* I knew this day would come, the day the people from Kazdel came.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: You don't like the Military Commission? Isn't Theresis your legendary hero?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: I'm every bit the Londinier that you are. I've never been anywhere else since I was born, and I don't know no Theresis.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Your accent, that's not how commoners talk. I take it you ended up here because of the folks from Kazdel?
attributes.name: Old Woman
Millscar
attributes.content: I—

attributes.name: Millscar
attributes.content: Never mind.
You're a good person, ma'am. No one else would come close to us at a time like this.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Without you, the new Parliament might've... nothing to be surprised, I suppose. The bigwigs never change, whatever happens.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I've seen enough in my lifetime.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: This new Parliament is different—
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Maybe. For people like us, though, it all feels the same.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: The aged Sarkaz soothes the sobbing child and sighs.
Don't be afraid, child. Your father is an honest man, more honest than most people I've met. He'll find you.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Alright... but where will you go after leaving here?
attributes.name: Indignant Child

attributes.content: I plan on visiting some old friends. They left during the withdrawal with their twins, who work for a pharmaceutical company.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Do you know them, ma'am?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: No. We have no time. You should get ready to leave.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: What is your name, ma'am?
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: We will not meet again.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Humor an old woman, won't you? I just want to thank you, on behalf of myself, and all those who are afraid of you—
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: And I would rather not direct this gratitude to a code name that's ready to be cast aside any time.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Allerdale.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Beautiful name. Thank you, Allerdale.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Allerdale. A name that should have been laid to rest in the Mausoleum of Kings.

In the darkness where even the passage of time became blurred, she had sought to die in the ruins of history, to be forgotten by all those whom she disappointed, yet she was afraid to die, afraid to be forgotten.
But when muddy water dripped from the hole that the Steam Knight left behind and fell upon her palm, she opened her eyes and saw light.
What lay at the end of the light was life, and submission again.
Her hesitation may have lasted three days, or three minutes... in the end, she made the same choice as she once did.
She recited it over and over in her mind, and crawled quietly into the light.
<p=1>Office of Provisional Supply Procurement</><p=2>December 12th, 1098, 5:32 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: What do you mean, the reservation with Madam Major is no longer valid and I have to get in queue again?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Should we be trying to buy time for the Infected who can't get medication?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I'm afraid the reservation system is under maintenance. There are a lot of files that need to be organized following Madam Major's passing.
attributes.name: Unperturbed Official

attributes.content: However, we are all very busy with preparations for Madam Major's funeral.
attributes.name: Unperturbed Official

attributes.content: How long are we talking?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: It should be up and running within seven business days. We will inform you as soon as reasonably possible.
attributes.name: Unperturbed Official

attributes.content: Have you been to the Center for Biological Infection Control? More and more citizens whose conditions are deteriorating rapidly are being sent there by the day.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Most Londiniers didn't know how to handle acute Oripathy attacks before the war. The ones who need help the most are the ones getting the least of it.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: They can't afford to wait... not to mention the proliferation of drugs that have little actual effectiveness...
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Your feedback is noted. We will pass it on to the Center for Biological Infection Control. Is there anything else I can help you with?
attributes.name: Unperturbed Official

attributes.content: Tell me where the Speaker's office is.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: If you would like to visit the Speaker, I can assist you in making a reservation—
attributes.name: Unperturbed Official

attributes.content: No need to ask him. I know where the Speaker is.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Come with me, Eliseo.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let us know if you need any other assistance. And thank you for the coffee, sir.
attributes.name: Unperturbed Official

attributes.content: It is a very valuable gift.
attributes.name: Unperturbed Official

attributes.content: Aren't you furious, Diane? This is no way for them to behave. I came to Londinium to—
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: To save us?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: No... that's not what I mean.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: But it's what you think, isn't it?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: I-I mean no offense. I'm grateful that you've put a roof over my head, but I also see there's nothing but chaos in the matter of helping the Infected here.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I get that it takes time to build up and improve systems and workflows. Please understand, though, that it was my job to raise such issues, back in Columbia.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I just want to see more regulated and effective workflow to provide help to more Infected. And if I may say so, we're a little ahead on that front.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I've never been to Columbia, Eliseo, and I don't know how people like us are treated back where you call home.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: I would love to see it, if I get the chance.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: But that gentleman has done nothing wrong. He has done what was tasked of him in such cases; in fact, he has done it better than any of his predecessors.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Londinium has many problems. But things are getting better, even better than before the war.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: It seems you trust this new Parliament?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: No, but I trust the Speaker. Come, I'll take you to her.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: How do you know where she is?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I take it you Columbians are not in the habit of listening to the broadcasts.
attributes.name: Diane
Eliseo
attributes.content: Well, we're more used to watching...

attributes.name: Eliseo
attributes.content: Never mind. Where is the Speaker?
At the memorial service for Madam Major.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Here? There are so many people, how do we get to the Speaker?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Come with me. I know a shortcut.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Through the window, Eliseo sees Vina Victoria for the first time.
He has done his homework, and heard the legends of the young Speaker during the war.
He thought the Speaker would be more impressive.
When he sees the well-dressed Aslan speaking at the podium, he feels nothing but disappointment—
Vina Victoria is not nearly as splendid as he imagined.
Are you lost?
If you're here for the service, the entrance is that way.
Would you like a hand, Eliseo?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Oh, er, thank you.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Hey, how did you—
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I was the one who put the files on Pure Heart Medical—and yourself—on the Speaker's table, long before you arrived in Londinium.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: So you know what I'm here for?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: And the Speaker knows what I've been trying to do for the past few days?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Unfortunately, it's not that simple.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I thought the Speaker would be different from the other nobles I've met.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Eliseo!
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: It's fine. I would just like to clear up the misunderstanding. This is not Columbia, Eliseo, and it is arrogance to judge us by your standards.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Sometimes, we must follow the rules first, in order to change things.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Not even she could do it?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Inside the hall, Vina is muttering something with a sad expression on her face, but they cannot hear what she is saying.
Delphine meets Diane's gaze, then quickly averts her eyes.
Was Madam Major another victim of the rules?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: No, only a respectable woman. One of those 'nobles' you were talking about.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: She could have stayed in Normandy, far from danger, but she came of her own accord to the chaos of Londinium in order to help the people here.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: She refused to stop working, even as her condition deteriorated, trying to help as many people as she could. Just like you, Eliseo.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Our conflict with her was only because of the harm that her radicalness and stubbornness were doing to herself.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: There are no dark secrets, no conspiracies behind her passing. She was not a 'victim'.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I'm sorry, I... I didn't know.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: But that makes it even harder to understand. Why do you refuse to work with Pure Heart? We're just trying to solve your problems.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Are you aware that Pure Heart Medical is backed by the Columbian Department of Defense and the Maylander Foundation?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Of course. The military and the Foundation have always been our main stakeholders.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: You... are a good, responsible man. Feel free to come and find me, if you insist on carrying out that responsibility.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Oh, er... you are...?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Delphine Windermere. You may call me Delphine. Looks like your company has work to do when it comes to client research.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I'm not giving up, Lady Delphine. I believe we can help with Londinium.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I can't make any promises on behalf of Vina or Parliament. But believe me when I say that we want to heal this city more than anyone else.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But, if you would like, you can come with me, to say goodbye to Madam Major...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: And to all those who have died in the chaos of the past few years.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The bell of mourning tolls. Fowlbeasts glide close to the ground, a sign of impeding rain.
Right now, though, nobody pays any heed. Their heads are bowed.
No tears are shed. War has already spent the city of its last drop.
All leads point to this place being Millscar's hideout. Why are you still taking your time?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Don't you think it's too easy?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Besides, there has been rumors of unidentified Sarkaz activity here. Can't hurt to be careful.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I say it can't hurt to have an accident or two. Good exercise.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Why do you think I refused to help Morgan with her stupid paperwork?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: You're an upright girl, to come along like this. I thought you'd shut yourself up in the tower as soon as you came back.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: You really ought to be staying put at the ship, Hannah. How many times has Medical reminded you about your condition—
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: The sound of bells echoes in the sky above the city. As if everything has gone quiet for a moment.
The memorial service has started.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Well—no time to wallow in sentiment. Let's go, Dagda. I don't want to get my arse kicked while I'm trying to wipe the tears from my eyes.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Sometimes I just don't know what to do with you, Hannah.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: What do we do if we run into Allerdale?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Punch her in the gut and leave the rest for Vina to worry about.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Who's there?!
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I'm afraid you won't find her. It's not you she wants to see.
Who are you?!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: The Rose Riverside's Canoe.
